subject: Education
title: Episodic vs. Semantic Memory
description: A 60-second lesson on Episodic vs. Semantic Memory.

hook.text: You know Paris is France's capital. You also remember your trip there. Different memory systems.

buildup.text: Semantic memory stores facts and concepts; episodic memory stores personal experiences.

discovery.text: Episodic memories include time, place, and emotion‚Äîsemantic memories are context-free.

twist.text: Some patients lose all episodic memory but keep semantic knowledge perfectly intact.

climax.text: Education primarily builds semantic memory, but embedding facts in stories creates both.

punchline.text: Facts live in your knowledge base. Experiences live in your life story.

quiz.question: What distinguishes episodic from semantic memory?
options: Episodic includes personal context; semantic stores context-free facts
Episodic is for visual information; semantic is for auditory
Episodic memories last longer than semantic ones
